description.narrative: National policies reflect evidence based strategies to reduce child morbidity and mortality

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
HIV - Emergency preparedness and response including Post exposure prophylaxis and risk informed conflict sensitive HIV programming
HIV and AIDS monitoring and bottleneck analysis
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
PMTCT program support such as retention in care, family planning, infant feeding, infant medical male circumcision and community facility linkages
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National policies reflect evidence based strategies to reduce child morbidity and mortality

description.narrative: In 2016 evidence contributed by UNICEF and partners, includes food fortification and salt iodisation, retention of mothers and children in HIV treatment, early infant diagnosis of HIV and the community health worker strategy. While fully prepared, dissemination of the health promotion strategy has been delayed. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of operational researches supported by UNICEF annually

actual.value: 2016:4 (PMTCT communication formative research, CHW Mapping, Emergency Nutrition Assessment(s), Cost of Hunger)

title.narrative: Availability of a new or revised policy for home visits of newborns (as a part of the newborn action plan)
